com.google.ase.terminal
Interface Screen

All Known Implementing Classes:
TranscriptScreen
public interface Screen

An abstract screen interface. A terminal screen stores lines of text.

Method Summary

          Set line wrap flag for a given row.
 

Method Detail

setLineWrap

void setLineWrap(int row)
Set line wrap flag for a given row. Affects how lines are logically wrapped when changing screen size or converting to a transcript.

set

void set(int x,
         int y,
         char c,
         int foreColor,
         int backColor)
Store byte b into the screen at location (x, y)

Parameters:
x - X coordinate (also known as column)
y - Y coordinate (also known as row)
c - ASCII character to store
foreColor - the foreground color
backColor - the background color

scroll

void scroll(int topMargin,
            int bottomMargin,
            int foreColor,
            int backColor)
Scroll the screen down one line. To scroll the whole screen of a 24 line screen, the arguments would be (0, 24).

Parameters:
topMargin - First line that is scrolled.
bottomMargin - One line after the last line that is scrolled.

blockCopy

void blockCopy(int sx,
               int sy,
               int w,
               int h,
               int dx,
               int dy)
Block copy characters from one position in the screen to another. The two positions can overlap. All characters of the source and destination must be within the bounds of the screen, or else an InvalidParemeterException will be thrown.

Parameters:
sx - source X coordinate
sy - source Y coordinate
w - width
h - height
dx - destination X coordinate
dy - destination Y coordinate

blockSet

void blockSet(int sx,
              int sy,
              int w,
              int h,
              int val,
              int foreColor,
              int backColor)
Block set characters. All characters must be within the bounds of the screen, or else and InvalidParemeterException will be thrown. Typically this is called with a "val" argument of 32 to clear a block of characters.

Parameters:
sx - source X
sy - source Y
w - width
h - height
val - value to set.
foreColor - the foreground color
backColor - the background color

getTranscriptText

java.lang.String getTranscriptText()
Get the contents of the transcript buffer as a text string.

Returns:
the contents of the transcript buffer.

resize

void resize(int columns,
            int rows,
            int foreColor,
            int backColor)
Resize the screen

Parameters:
columns -
rows -
